conclusion: Consider effects of light and shadow on objects A, B, C, and D when light source moves forward.
Object A (cake) is casting a shadow on the ground.
Shadow of the cake will move forward when the light source moves forward.
Size of the shadow of the cake will remain the same because the light source is still above it.
Object B (calendar) is casting a shadow on the ground.
Shadow of the calendar will move forward when the light source moves forward.
Size of the shadow of the calendar will remain the same because the light source is still above it.
Object C (box) is casting a shadow on the ground.
Shadow of the box will move forward when the light source moves forward.
Size of the shadow of the box will remain the same because the light source is still above it.
Object D (baseball) is casting a shadow on the ground.
Shadow of the baseball will move forward when the light source moves forward.
Size of the shadow of the baseball will remain the same because the light source is still above it.
All objects A, B, C, and D will move forward as the light source moves forward above them. The size of the shadows will remain the same.
